intro: Astragalus harmsii, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus harmsii is also valued for its role in ecological systems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
